documents.content:
# California Child Care Subsidy Income Eligibility Overview (2025-26)

## State Median Income (SMI) Thresholds

California uses State Median Income (SMI) to determine eligibility for subsidized child care programs. For fiscal year 2025-26 (July 1, 2025 - June 30, 2026):

### 100% SMI (CSPP Eligibility)
| Family Size | Yearly Income | Monthly Income |
|-------------|---------------|----------------|
| 1-2 persons | $96,854 | $8,071 |
| 3 persons | $109,904 | $9,159 |
| 4 persons | $127,344 | $10,612 |
| 5 persons | $147,715 | $12,309 |
| 6 persons | $168,086 | $14,007 |
| 7 persons | $171,913 | $14,326 |
| 8 persons | $175,740 | $14,644 |

### 85% SMI (CDSS Program Eligibility)
| Family Size | Yearly Income | Monthly Income |
|-------------|---------------|----------------|
| 1-2 persons | $82,326 | $6,860 |
| 3 persons | $93,418 | $7,785 |
| 4 persons | $108,237 | $9,020 |
| 5 persons | $125,558 | $10,463 |

## Program Eligibility by Income Level

**Below 75% SMI:**
- Eligible for all programs
- NO family fees (zero copay)

**75% - 85% SMI:**
- Eligible for CDSS programs (CCTR, CAPP, CalWORKs Stage 3)
- Family fees capped at 1% of income

**85% - 100% SMI:**
- Eligible for California State Preschool Program (CSPP) only
- Family fees capped at 1% of income

**Above 100% SMI:**
- Not income-eligible for subsidized care
- May still qualify through special categories (foster care, at-risk, homeless)

## Key Points
- Income is calculated as adjusted monthly income with specific deductions
- Families receiving CalWORKs, Medi-Cal, CalFresh, or WIC can use income from those applications
- 24-month continuous eligibility protects families from losing care due to income fluctuations

**Source:** California Department of Education Management Bulletin 25-05
**URL:** https://www.cde.ca.gov/sp/cd/ci/mb2505.asp
